title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: FULL INTERVIEW: A group of lawyers have come together to offer free legal advice to those that need it most, as close to half a million Australians are unable to access legal help, largely due to the costs associated. Anika is an online platform that provides legal advice at no cost, by connecting people with law students that want to help which is checked by the company’s experienced lawyers. CEO and co founder of Anika Legal Noel Lim told Sky News “there is a massive problem with access to justice” and “practical training was really difficult to get”. “We saw an opportunity to address both of the issues with the same idea”. Image: Getty
